avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow is considered rather stable after freeze-thawing cycles this weekend.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snow has settled after thaw and heavy rain last weekend. The snowpack is considered stable.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.
travelAdvisory.highlights: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður næstu daga og dægursveiflur í hitastigi.

avalancheActivity.comment: Quite a few avalanches occurred in the thaw over the weekend.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Saturday was warm with rain. Wet avalanches could occur while the snowpack adjusts.

snowpackStructure.highlights: The snowpack is most likely becoming rather homogenous after frost and thaw cycles. Some wet sluffs could occur in the fair weather in the next few days. Windslabs were present before and some layering could still be in the snowpack.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.
travelAdvisory.highlights: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæg breytileg átt næstu daga og bjart með köflum. Hiti yfir frostmarki yfir daginn en næturfrost víða.

avalancheActivity.comment: Wide slab avalanche fell in Kotafjall in Svarfaðardalur, another smaller one in Skíðadalur on 20.04, another size 2 wet loose avalanche released in Þrastarstaðaskál in Höfðaströnd. Large slab avalanche fell in NW-winds on 15th April in Fljót.
avalancheActivity.highlights: Snow has subsided somewhat in the thaw this weekend and snow has become wet and but not in highest mountains. Snow is affected by diurnal temperature fluctuations and solar radiation. Considerable snow still in high elevations and new windslabs in N and E aspects.

snowpackStructure.highlights: Thaw during the weekend and snow has subsided and stiffened somewhat, but is affected by diurnal temperature fluctuations and solar radiation, especially in lower elevations. Considerable snow is high in mountains and windslabs formed in S- and SW wind on Sunday. A snowpit in Burstabrekkudalur gave CT11RP but ECTX, a weak layer by an ice layer on top of old firn persists. Warm weather and solar radiation affects the top layers of the snow and chance of wet avalanches.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.
travelAdvisory.highlights: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hæglætis veður næstu daga. Dægursveiflur í hitastigi og hlýindi í kortunum.

avalancheActivity.comment: A skier triggered a small avalanche in Oddsskarð on Sunday. A few small avalanches occurred in the thaw last weekend. Several loose avalanches seen by Neskaupstaður on Tuesday and Wednesday. Few small avalanches have been seen around the area after last weeks snowfall and warming.
avalancheActivity.highlights: The weekend was warm and a few avalanches were seen in the area. A skier triggered a small avalanche in Oddsskarð on Sunday. Small avalanches could continue to occur in the next few days. A lot of snow is still in the mountains and inland, and layers could still be present.

snowpackStructure.highlights: A lot of snow is still in the mountains. Saturday was warm and a few small sluffs occurred in the area. The snowpack is expected to become stronger when it starts to freeze, but some sluffs could occur in the sun in the next few days. Layered wind slabs were present and some layering could still be in the snowpack. Cornices are widely on S-W aspects. A deep persistent weak layer could still be present at high elevations.

travelAdvisory.comment: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.
travelAdvisory.highlights: It thawed in all Iceland on Saturday. Frost during the night will most likely make the snowpack stronger but small wet avalanches could occur, especially in the sun in the coming days.

weatherForecast.highlights: Hægar breytilegar áttir næstu daga og bjart veður. Hiti yfir frostmarki yfir daginn en víða næturfrost.
